content:
TITLE: Configuring HTTP/2 Disable Setting for Corporate Proxies in Cursor
DESCRIPTION: A JSON setting to disable HTTP/2 in Cursor when facing connectivity issues with corporate proxies like Zscaler. This setting helps resolve problems with Cursor Tab and Cmd K functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/troubleshooting/common-issues.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"cursor.general.disableHttp2": true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring .cursorignore File Example in Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: An example of a .cursorignore file that demonstrates how to ignore directories, file types, and specific files. The format is similar to .gitignore with pattern matching for exclusions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/context/ignore-files.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# Ignore all files in the `dist` directory
dist/

# Ignore all `.log` files
*.log

# Ignore specific file `config.json`
config.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Keyboard Shortcuts in Cursor Chat
DESCRIPTION: Various keyboard shortcuts used to control Cursor Chat functionality, including opening the AI pane, submitting queries, and triggering AI fix.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/chat/overview.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Ctrl/⌘ + L           # Toggle and focus AI pane
Ctrl/⌘ + Alt/Option + L # Open chat history
Ctrl/⌘ + Shift + E      # AI fix
Ctrl/⌘ .               # Toggle chat modes
Alt/Option Enter        # Submit query without context
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Keyboard Shortcuts for Accepting or Rejecting Applied Code in Cursor
DESCRIPTION: Keyboard shortcuts for accepting or rejecting code changes after applying a suggestion from chat. Use Ctrl/⌘ Enter to accept the changes, or Ctrl/⌘ Backspace to reject them.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/chat/apply.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Ctrl/⌘ Enter to accept, Ctrl/⌘ Backspace to reject.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Privacy Mode Setting Path
DESCRIPTION: Indicates the configuration path to enable Privacy Mode in Cursor settings, which prevents code storage except for temporary OpenAI processing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/privacy/privacy.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Privacy Mode
```

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Cursor Settings > General > Privacy Mode
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom AI Review Instructions in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to provide custom instructions for AI Review to focus on specific aspects of the code, such as performance. These instructions guide the AI in scanning through code changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/advanced/ai-review.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```
focus on the performance of my code
```
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using @ Symbol for Link Integration in Cursor
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the syntax for adding a link that Cursor should visit before responding. The @ symbol must be prefixed to the URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/context/@-symbols/@-link.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
@https://your-link.com
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Windows Log Files for Cursor
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the file path to access Cursor log files on Windows operating systems. These logs are essential for diagnosing issues and understanding application behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/troubleshooting/troubleshooting-guide.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: txt
CODE:
```
C:\Users\<your-user-name>\AppData\Roaming\Cursor\logs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Mintlify CLI for Cursor Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Mintlify CLI globally using npm, which is required for previewing documentation changes locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i -g mintlify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Mintlify Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Mintlify development server at the root of the documentation folder where mint.json is located, enabling local preview of documentation changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mintlify dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Markdown Title for Keyboard Shortcuts Documentation
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the title of a markdown document for keyboard shortcuts. It uses YAML front matter to set the title of the page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/miscellaneous/keyboard-shortcuts.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
---
title: Keyboard Shortcuts
---
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigation Path Reference
DESCRIPTION: UI navigation path for accessing subscription management in Cursor application
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/get-started/usage.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
Cursor Settings > General > Account
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Subscription Tier Code References
DESCRIPTION: Code reference identifiers for different models and tiers used in Cursor's subscription system
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/get-started/usage.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
premium\ncursor-small
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Premium Model Types
DESCRIPTION: Code reference showing premium model type identifier
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/get-started/usage.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
premium
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pro Tier Model Reference
DESCRIPTION: Code reference showing Pro tier model identifier for business comparison
SOURCE: https://github.com/getcursor/docs/blob/main/get-started/usage.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
Pro
```
